Fields.DialogueText: Laying out in the storm again, huh?
I'm still cooling down.
I've felt like I've been on fire since our little trip to the Mediterranean.

Fields.MenuText: How many times do I have to say I'm sorry?
Sounds like a personal problem. I enjoyed myself.
All right, but I'm still worried you're going to get sick.

Fields.DialogueText: Every time you ask, that the amount increases.
Well, I wonder how much you would've enjoyed sinking to the bottom of the sea if I hadn't been there to save your butt.
If I've caught a cold, that would mean hell has frozen over, Captain. We'd have bigger problems than the sniffles.
All right, well, enjoy the storm, Salmon. I'll go see how our resupply is going.
Captain, we've had reports of Morganas sighted just off the coast. They seem to have their eyes on us.
Well, let's see how appetizing we look when we're bombarding them with torpedoes.
@BATTLE
Then I'll stop asking. Thanks for the tip.
That's what I'm here for. To make sure you don't keep making stupid choices.
Okay, I get it, I owe you one. Calm down.
I am perfectly calm. I'll be even more calm when you leave me alone to enjoy the rain.
And here I was thinking hell had frozen over when Morganas started attacking and eating ships and battleships started coming to life.
I have a feeling we haven't seen anything yet.
Captain, if you're not busy, I was hoping we could talk.
I have a few minutes. What did you want to talk about?
What's your family like?
Starting personal, I see...

Fields.MenuText: We're very close. I'd do anything for them.
I can't stand my family. I joined the military to get away from them.
Why do you ask?

Fields.DialogueText: I see, so they're important to you...
I suppose families aren't always a source of joy and love for some people.
Hmmm. You're being a bit evasive, aren't you?
What about your family?
My family?
Yeah, I mean, I know you're a Belle, but I understand that many of you have sisters - quite a lot sometimes.
So you're asking if I have sisters?
Sure, that's a good place to start.
*ALARM*
It seems like we'll have to continue this conversation later.
What convenient timing, don't you think?
No. Convenient would be if the Morganas decided to leave Earth entirely. This is just annoying.
@BATTLE
*KNOCK*
Come in!
Captain, I have something to report.

Fields.MenuText: Can it wait? I'm a little busy here.
Well, spill it. It must be urgent - you haven't even dried off yet.
Why are you dripping all over my floor?

Fields.DialogueText: If it could wait, I would've at least toweled off my hair before coming to you.
Yes, I rushed right to you after coming in from the ocean.
I didn't have time to grab a towel after my swim. I was in too much of a hurry to see you.
I was swimming alongside the submarine when I caught view of a school of fish.
I watched them for a bit until they got too far away, but before I turned away, I saw, in the distance, a pair of Morganas sailing away from us.
Away? What's so urgent then? They're not about to attack us.
No, but I think we should follow them.
You want us to ambush a couple of Morganas? That's still not my idea of urgent.
What I'm saying is that we should follow them to wherever they're headed. If I'm right, they'll lead us to a few of their friends.
You suspect they're meeting up with a raiding party?
Exactly, and if we don't start after them soon, we'll lose them.
Urgent enough for you yet?
Yeah, I'll say. Let's hurry.
@BATTLE
Salmon, you in here? I brought you lunch.
You brought me lunch? Why would you do that?
You weren't in the mess hall, so I figured I'd bring the food to you.
Plus, the only thing I've ever seen you eat are hazelnuts. That's a little disconcerting, to say the least.
My diet is perfectly fine, thank you very much. No need for you to worry.

Fields.MenuText: So you don't want the food?
Okay, more food for me.
Well, I guess I'll have to just throw all this food away. Such a waste...

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't say that.
Hey, hey, hey, not so fast, Captain.
No need to waste the food!
Just... give me the lunch, already.
It's yours.
Thanks... I was kinda hungry...
What was that?
Nothing... uh, I think I sense a few Morganas nearby.
*ALARM*
Sounds like the alarm senses them too.
I guess my lunch will have to wait. Go to it!
@BATTLE
Is Salmon still outside swimming?
I think so. I haven't seen her come back in.
It's been longer than usual. Are we sure she's all right?
Well it's not like a shark could've eaten her... right?
Salmon! Get back in here!
If you're not in a shark's belly.
Even if she was eaten by a shark, couldn't she just phase through it like she does with the ship?
I don't know. I've never tried. It'd be an interesting experiment, though.

Fields.MenuText: What were you doing out there, Salmon?
You were starting to worry us. Are you okay?
Next time, report in before we start thinking you were eaten. Or you'll lose those swimming privileges.

Fields.DialogueText: I know I've been out for a while, sorry. I just got distracted.
I'm fine, no sharks or anything. I just got a little distracted and lost track of time.
You wouldn't do that... would you? I'm sorry. It won't happen again.
This little fish has been swimming alongside us, and he's so cute. I just wanted to watch him all day. I'm sorry.
You want to go back out and swim with him some more, don't you?
... How'd you know?
You literally have one foot out the door.
*shrugs*
Just go already. Keep an ear out for Morganas.
Thanks, Captain.
Honestly, sometimes...
Eeeek, he's still out there! So cute!
Heh.
@BATTLE
Captain, do you have some time?
Well, let's see... you're not dripping wet, so I'll assume this doesn't have to do with Morganas.
Nope. Not yet, at least. You never know when they could pop up.
So you're here to ask more personal questions?
Maybe.
In that case...

Fields.MenuText: Sit down. Let's talk.
You can leave. I'm not in the mood.
Only if you go first.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad to see you're being so receptive.
Not in the mood for what, exactly?
You mean you want to ask me a question? Well go ahead, I have nothing to hide from you.
I... we have Morganas nearby, I guess we'll have to finish this conversation later.
You can count on that, Salmon.
@BATTLE
Why wouldn't I be? It's just a conversation.
Exactly. It's a pleasant experience to talk with someone, get to know them better and maybe learn something new.
I don't feel like I know enough about you, though.
To have a one-way conversation with you.
If it were a one-way conversation, then I wouldn't be talking.
You talk, but you don't really tell me much. I don't feel like I know anything about you.
I've noticed you don't like to talk about yourself. Why is that?
I'm not all that interesting. I'd rather learn more about you.
You don't think you're interesting? Maybe you should let me be the judge of that.
Man, why did we have to make port here?
I thought you loved it here. You were talking about how beautiful the rolling hills were.
Well they are. And here I am, only able to stare at them from a distance.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, I see. That really isn't fair, is it?
Don't get greedy. At least you're not in the Mediterranean again.
Maybe one day you'll get to walk those hills.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, but it could be worse.
You're right. That would be worse. Thanks, Captain.
Maybe, but for now, I'm stuck admiring them from afar.
If you want, you can go back inside while we're here. We won't be much longer.
No, I want to enjoy it as long as I can. It's bittersweet, but it's better than nothing.
If you're sure, I'll let you know when we're heading out.
@BATTLE
*KNOCK*
Come in, Captain.
Hey. You weren't in the mess hall again. I brought you some food.
I told you you didn't have to do this, didn't I?

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, but can't I do something nice for a friend?
I'm your captain, I do what I want.
You know you're hungry.

Fields.DialogueText: Friend, huh? Thanks, I was starting to get a little hungry.
Really? You're going to pull rank now? ... Fine. I was starting to get hungry.
Don't pretend like you know me. If I were hungry, I'd say I was hungry.
Well, here's your food. You know, if you started coming down to the mess hall, I wouldn't have to be your meal deliverer.
I'm just too busy to go all the way to the mess and back. Maybe if it were closer.
Busy doing what, exactly?
I'm sorry?
I asked what you're doing in there.
That's what I thought you said. It looks like my hearing is fine. I'll talk to you later, Captain.
Wait you still haven't... *door slam* ... answered my question...
*ALARM*
Salmon, eat fast, we've got Morganas!
Heh, I never get to warn her. It's usually the other way around. Felt good.
@BATTLE
*stomach growl*
... I'm hungry. Now. Now I'm hungry.
Salmon's still in the water, isn't she?
Yeah, but she checked in. She said that her fish friend was back.
That's great, but I need to talk to her. It's kind of important.
Salmon!
You rang, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: You look chipper.
It still creeps me out when just stick your head in like that.
Having fun?

Fields.DialogueText: Do I? I've been having fun teaching Adam some new tricks.
Sorry, but I'm worried that Adam will swim away if I come all the way in.
Yeah, Adam's been keeping me company out here.
Adam?
The fish that's been following us. I taught him how to backflip. It's the cutest thing.
I'm really glad you're in a good mood, because uh...
Hold on a second... yeah, I'm sensing a few Morganas headed straight for us.
Well, you heard her, it's time to get ready. Sound the alarm.
Did you have something to tell me?
It can wait.
If you say so. I'll be right back.
Where are you going?
I have to shoo Adam to safety.
@BATTLE
Captain, you said you had something to tell me?
Yes. Yes, I did. Sit down. This won't be easy to say.
I've always found that when something is difficult to say, that it's best to just blurt it out.

Fields.MenuText: We're going back to the Mediterranean!
Mediterranean!
In this case, I think I think it's better to just say it gently. We're needed back in the Mediterranean, so we're going back.

Fields.DialogueText: What!?
What about that horrible place? Wait... don't tell me we're going back there!
... We're going back? ... Why?
Apparently some version of Delusion has come back - with double the force. They've been attacking towns up and down the North African coast.
Before they just had a lot of Morganas in their waters... it's our fault they're dealing with them on land too now, right?
Probably.
*ALARM*
... Okay, well, if we're going back, we need to make a quick supply run. There's something I'll be needing if we're going back there.
Deal.
First, let's turn this alarm off, though.
@BATTLE
Captain, I just wanted to stop by and thank you.
For what?
You told me about the Mediterranean this time. Now I have time to prepare myself, unlike last time.

Fields.MenuText: I just wanted to avoid you pouting the whole time we're there.
I'll admit I didn't handle it as well as I should have last time, but I learned my lesson.
I'm really sorry we have to go back. I know how much you hate the heat.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I can't make any promises there, but I'll try to keep in a good mood for as long as I can.
It would seem you did. I'm glad you're a quick learner.
Yeah, I do. But I think I have a way to work around that.
Oh, and about our last conversation... you said you didn't feel like you know enough about me... so... I thought maybe... you could ask anything you wanted and I'd answer it honestly.
Really? Anything I want?
Anything. I'll give you a one hundred percent honest answer.
I might have to think about this for a little while. I'll keep it in my back pocket for now.
Wait, that's not fair!
*ALARM*
Well if you really want me to ask right now, I guess we can turn off the alarms and ask the Morganas to wait while we talk.
You win this time, Captain.
@BATTLE
All right, we're here.
So... what exactly did you need to pick up before we headed back to the Mediterranean?
Is that your one question I have to answer honestly?

Fields.MenuText: No.
... Maybe?
You'd like that, wouldn't you?

Fields.DialogueText: Then you'll have to wait and see.
In that case, maybe I'll tell you.
Yes. Yes, I would.
Salmon, here's your ice. Where do you want us to store it?
Find room for it in the kitchen for now. I'll deal with it soon.
Got it.
That's a lot of ice, Salmon.
Yes. Yes, it is. It cost you a pretty penny too.
Of course it did.
*laughter*
You know ice melts, don't you?
I'm working on it. I've got a plan, you'll see.
You do have a way with plans. I'll give you that.
I do... like right now, I'm planning to get the ship ready for battle. We've got Morganas headed toward us.
It's like flies to honey. Sound the alarm!
@BATTLE
Salmon?
Salmon! Where are you?
Sorry, Captain. I'm out here saying goodbye to Adam. He looks so sad.

Fields.MenuText: Sad? Are you sure he even understands a word you're saying? He's a fish.
I'm sure he'll still be here when we get back.
How do you talk in the ocean?

Fields.DialogueText: Fish have rich inner lives, Captain. Don't be so cold-hearted.
I guess you're right. I just know he's going to miss me. He's such a mama's boy.
With meaningful looks and gestures. And minor telepathy.
*ALARM*
Is that the alarm, or are my ears ringing?
That's the alarm. Say bye to Adam for now.
I'll be right back to take out these Morganas.
@BATTLE
I'm not cold-hearted. I just prefer my fish fried.
You're so lucky he can't hear you right now!
You're his mama now? I think you might be getting a little too close to this fish.
I don't think that's for you to decide now, is it?
I'm guessing you do most of the talking?
Sometimes he's in a talkative mood too.
You actually came down to the mess this time?
Yeah, I was getting hungry. And I didn't want you to stop by my room again.
What... are those specks on your food?
Oh, I crushed up some hazelnuts and sprinkled them on my lunch. It's not that weird, right?

Fields.MenuText: No, not weird at all. It's just a little seasoning.
Why do you like hazelnuts so much anyway?
It's pretty weird. It's an odd combo.

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly. And it compliments everything I add it to. It's delicious, but not too overpowering.
You mean you don't like them? How can anyone not like hazelnuts?
That's the voice of inexperience if I've ever heard it. Don't judge it until you taste it yourself.
Well, either way, I think I'll stick with my lunch how it is.
Fine, more hazelnuts for me.
Hey, slow down, there's no rush, Salmon.
Actually *munch*  there is. *swallow* I'm sensing a few Morganas nearby. They're headed our way.
Well, I guess I better hurry too.
@BATTLE
Hello, Salmon.
You're looking... tense.
Is there a reason we've surfaced, Captain? We're sitting ducks, out here like this.

Fields.MenuText: We're surfaced? There must be something wrong with the ship! We're all gonna die!
Well, I planned a little surprise for you. I don't think it'll take long.
No reason... wanted to take in the view... it'll probably look better than the inside of this submarine.

Fields.DialogueText: Very funny, Captain, but I'd know if there was something going on with the ship. So what's really going on?
And what exactly is this surprise you've planned?
I guess having a captain that doesn't know how to lie is technically a good thing.
I just thought you might want to say goodbye to the Pacific before we headed back into the belly of the beast. Was I wrong?
Oh, that's very thoughtful. Thank you.
But, it's okay, I said my goodbyes already. And besides, we'll be back soon enough.
If you're sure, then I guess it's time to start moving.
Captain, Salmon, we've been spotted by a couple Morganas on the horizon. They're headed straight for us.
I told you this would happen.
Right as usual, Salmon.
Go to it!
@BATTLE
It's just as bad as I remembered it.
Is that ice you bought helping at all?
It's not working as well as I would've hoped, but it's definitely better than last time.

Fields.MenuText: What exactly are you doing with it anyway?
Well, whatever you're doing behind closed doors, Salmon, is your own business.
Like I said, ice melts.

Fields.DialogueText: Is that your one question?
Thank you... wait a minute... why do I feel like you're assuming something untoward?
That's not even close to the problem, Captain.
*ALARM*
This heat isn't going to keep you from putting your all in the fight, is it?
That's the stupidest question you've asked all day.
@BATTLE
You know the answer to that already.
Then you should know better than to ask a question I won't answer.
What you're doing with that ice is your business and what I think you're doing with that ice is my business.
Shut up this instant or your perverted thoughts will spread!
Then what is the problem?
It's my problem. And I'll solve it.
Captain?
What can I do for you?
Oh, just... so, what is our plan going forward?

Fields.MenuText: Plan? We don't need no stinkin' plan.
I was hoping you'd help me figure that out, actually.
You mean you haven't figured one out yet? Uh oh.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, actually we do. It's kind of important for warfare. I mean, at least if you want to win.
Why didn't you say so? You know how much I love to plan.
Actually, I've already started putting one together. I was just waiting for you to ask for my opinion.
The way I see it, we know the Morganas have been raiding up and down the coast, so all we need to do is strike when they're least expecting it.
Which would be?
In the middle of one of their attacks.
I see. They'd be too distracted attacking to notice us coming from the other direction. Impressive, Salmon.
Did you expect anything less?
Captain, there are a few Morganas to our south.
Are they a part of the raiding party?
Their numbers aren't large enough, so I'm guessing not.
Go to it, then! It'll be a good appetizer.
@BATTLE
Hello, Captain. What's with that look on your face?
Actually, I've been thinking a lot lately.
About? Or are you going to make me guess?

Fields.MenuText: About our plan to attack the Morganas.
About what I want to ask you for my one question.
About what you're doing with all that ice.

Fields.DialogueText: Do you have a problem with it?
Do you finally know what you're going to ask me?
Whatever you're thinking, I can promise you're wrong.
*ALARM*
And that's the alarm. So we'll have to continue this conversation later.
@BATTLE
It just seems a little cruel. Waiting to attack until they're busy destroying a city? It feels like we might just be letting people die.
People die. That's rule number one for wartime strategy. The only thing we can affect is the number. I honestly feel that this plan will save the most lives in the long run.
You're probably right. I'm just over thinking this.
No... I'm struggling with a handful of options. They just all seem like they could have really good answers.
Well, if you want to run them by me, I can tell you which ones have boring answers.
That'd be a tempting offer. If I thought for a second you'd tell me the truth.
I could be right. I'm probably not... you don't still own your Girl Guide uniform, do you?
Please don't make that the one question I have to answer honestly. I don't want to promote those thoughts in your head.
No need, that was enough of an answer for me.
Salmon?
Lunch delivery! Anyone home?
Captain? You brought me food again? Just wait a second!

Fields.MenuText: Don't take too long, my stomach is starting to growl.
Take your time. It's not like I'm the captain with important stuff to do.
Do I need to start counting down from ten?

Fields.DialogueText: You better not touch my food!
I'm hurrying, I'm hurrying!
No need. Almost there!
Hey, sorry about that. My room is kind of a mess.
Is that why you phased through the door instead of opening it like a normal person?
What? I'm not allowed to use my natural Belle abilities?
No... I guess you can do what you want, it's just a little weird.
Luckily, I don't put too much stock into what you think. But thanks anyway for the food.
No problem.
Mmmm, it's delicious.
You're... just going to eat it out here?
*ALARM*
Nope. I'm going to eat it on the road.
Morganas are always ready to ruin a meal or two.
@BATTLE
Anything to report?
Just give me three seconds...
All right, we have eyes on our targets. Take a look.

Fields.MenuText: More than I expected.
They call that a force? We won't break a sweat taking them on.
We do? I must be looking through the wrong scope.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't let their numbers fool you. What they have in quantity they more than likely lack in quality.
Don't get too cocky. They're fairly sizable.
Let me adjust it for you. See them now?
So now we just wait for them to open fire and we'll attack while they're preoccupied.
Exactly. And by the looks of it, we won't have to wait long.
It looks like they're already opening fire. Are we ready to engage?
At your command, Captain.
What do you say, Salmon?
Go to it! Let's finish our business and get out of here!
@BATTLE
Ah, yes. Thanks, Salmon.
Salmon? You in there? You aren't out swimming, are you?
Okay, I'm coming in... if you're in there, I hope you're decent.
*opens door*
*SPLASH*
Cold! Why is your room filled with water!? And why is it freezing!?
Captain! What did you do!?

Fields.MenuText: I was looking for you! Are we taking on water?
What did I do? What did you do?!
I had an accident. I just couldn't hold it anymore.

Fields.DialogueText: No, no, we're not! Remember my plan? Well you're soaked in it.
What I do in my room is my own business.
Not the time for jokes! My water is getting everywhere!
Just shut the door, shut the door! Before you let it all out.
Whatever you say, but I think it's a little late for that.
Can you please explain what all that was?
Like you said... ice melts. And turns into water. I turned my room into a makeshift pool.
And how is it still cold?
I didn't use all the ice right away. I've been restocking it to keep it nice and refreshing.
You know what... just next time warn me before you do something crazy like that.
That wasn't crazy. That was ingenuity. I'm just happy it lasted long enough.
*ALARM*
Oh, that's the alarm. So either we're being attacked, or your “ingenuity” shorted out some circuits.
Either way, I'm sure I can handle it.
@BATTLE
Goodbye, fiery waters.
I hope I never have to deal with you again.
Ever.

Fields.MenuText: Done yet?
So do I. I don't think we can handle another pool spill.
You had to have had a little fun, right?

Fields.DialogueText: I'll be done when we're back in the Pacific.
Excuse me, that wasn't my fault. You were the one who opened my door.
Let me think about that... none at all.
Now, I'd much appreciate it if you'd allow me to return to cursing the bane of my existence. Thank you.
Can you at least curse with your hand back inside?
Not until the water gets cold again.
Please, when we get back to the North Pacific, the first thing you'll do is go for a swim.
You really are a quick learner.
Captain, there's a line of Morganas blocking our way.
Blocking our way?
It's like they're trying to keep us from leaving the Mediterranean.
Oh, really now? I'd like to see them try. Let me at them, right now! I'll tear them to pieces!
That doesn't seem like such a bad idea to me, actually. Let's go everyone, prepare to engage!
@BATTLE
Still in the water?
You guessed it.
Salmon!
You called, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Did you find Adam?
Enjoying yourself out there?
Aren't you done yet?

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, he swam right to me. He's such a sweetheart.
Of course. There's no substitute for this water. It's feels fantastic floating along the ship. Especially with Adam swimming alongside me.
I'll be done when I'm good and ready. Actually, when Adam and I are good and ready.
I knew Adam would be waiting right here for you.
Yeah, I should've known he wouldn't stray too far away from where his momma left him.
Well when you get a chance, I'd like to talk to you.
Oh? Sure, we'll be done playing soon.
You'll be done playing now, I think. Morganas don't respect the love between a girl and her fish.
Bloody Morganas! Give me a second, Captain. I'll be right in.
@BATTLE
So, I think I know what you wanted to talk to me about.
You do?
Yup. You finally figured out what you wanted to ask me.
Actually, I did, but that's not what I wanted to talk to you about.
Then what is it?
I've been your captain for a while, and you've remained pretty aloof, much of the time. I just wanted to make sure you were happy with our current situation.
Is that your one question?
I'm hoping it doesn't have to be.
... You can be a pain in my neck sometimes, you like to stick your nose in my business, and I don't really like it when you play the whole “captain” card.
So then you...
But you also respect my opinion, most of the time. You know I'll do whatever I can to protect this ship and its crew, so you mostly let me do as I like.
And despite all your faults, I can tell you're a good person. I'm happy with you as my captain.
I'm not just your captain.

Fields.MenuText: I'm your friend.
I'm a superhero.
I'm a Belle too.

Fields.DialogueText: That goes without saying.
Really? Would your power happen to be the supernatural ability to annoy me at any time?
*laughs* Yeah, and I'm the queen of England.
*ALARM*
Yeah, I guess we can talk later. Let's go to it!
@BATTLE
I'd love to keep talking, Salmon, but it seems like the Morganas are against that idea.
I'd love to keep talking, citizen, but it seems like the Morganas are against that idea.
I'd love to keep talking, Your Majesty, but it seems like the Morganas are against that idea.
Hey, Captain, you said you had your question in mind. Aren't you going to ask it?
You actually sound like you want me to ask it.
I just want to get this over with. I don't like having this hanging over my head.

Fields.MenuText: Why don't you like talking about yourself?
Want to get some ice cream?
Does this uniform make me look fat?

Fields.DialogueText: Right to the big question, huh?
Ice cream? That's your big question?
Seriously? I give you one honest answer and that's the question you choose?
You have to be honest, remember?
I guess it's because I think humans are just so much more interesting.
I mean, I've only been able to walk and talk and breathe like this for so long, but the rest of you have had your entire lives.
It's all so much more interesting than anything I've ever done before.
Salmon, I never even thought about it that way. I promise I won't push anymore.
Thank you, Captain. I prefer to think of my past as a prologue. My real story is just starting now.
That's a good way to think about it. *alarm* Hey, I think that's your next chapter calling. How do you like the title, “A Morgana's Defeat?”
I like the sound of it.
I figure if there's anything I really need to know you'll tell me on your own. I don't need to dig.
That's... kind of sweet.
Just like ice cream. It's cold, and I know that's your favorite.
Okay, fine. Let's get some ice cream.
*alarm* It looks like we'll have to wait until after we beat a few Morganas.
We can work up our appetites.
No lying. I've been wondering all day and I obviously can't trust the crew.
You look very dashing in your uniform. Happy?
Hee, you called me dashing.
Stop smiling. Don't let it get to your head.
*alarm* Uh oh, looks like we've got Morganas attacking. I hope I don't mess up my dashing uniform.
Okay, calm down, you don't look that great.
Okay, fine. I'll ask.
